body_content.explanation: a type of medium-sized owl (= a bird with a flat face and large eyes that hunts small mammals and birds at night) found in Europe and North Africa, with brownish or greyish upper parts marked with small dark and light lines, and lighter lower parts marked with small dark lines:
examples: A tawny owl hooted in the distance.

body_content.explanation: in the UK and some other countries, an adult who is the leader of a group of Brownies (= an international organization for girls aged between around seven and ten), or the title given to this person:
examples: Tawny Owl helped us make things such as decorations and raffia mats.
The title Tawny Owl is still used in some Brownie packs.
